title: Curried Red Lentil Flatbread with Arugula Pesto (Gluten-Free)
directions: Be sure to follow the above steps for soaking the lentils.
Rinse and drain the lentils of any excess water.
Process the lentils with the remaining ingredients (1/2 cup water, salt, and curry) for at least 60-90 seconds (the resulting batter should be smooth).
Prepare an 8- or 9-inch cake pan for the batter by spraying the pan with a light layer of oil.
Place a fitted sheet of parchment paper into the pan.
Pour the two tablespoons of oil atop the parchment paper.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan.
Bake the bread for 20-25 minutes, until firm to the touch and top is cracked a bit.
Pulse the garlic clove in a processor until chopped fine.
Add in the arugula and basil.
With the processor running, slowly add in the olive oil.
Pulse in the parmesan, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
ingredients: ⅔ c. red lentils, soaked in ¾ cup water for 2-3 hours (they should plump up fairly quick)
2 T. oil (coconut and olive work great!)
½ c. extra virgin olive oil
